      • lock

      • recycle

        public void recycle()

      • nextContent

        protected abstract T nextContent()
                          throws IOException
        Access the next content to be consumed from. Returning the next item does not consume it and it may be returned multiple times until it is consumed. Calls to get(Object, byte[], int, int) or consume(Object, int) are required to consume data from the content.
        Returns:
        Content or null if none available.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getNextContent

        protected T getNextContent()
                    throws IOException
        A convenience method to call nextContent and to check the return value, which if null then the a check is made for EOF and the state changed accordingly.
        Returns:
        Content or null if none available.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        nextContent()

      • earlyEOF

        public void earlyEOF()
        This method should be called to signal to the HttpInput that an EOF has arrived before all the expected content. Typically this will result in an EOFException being thrown from a subsequent read rather than a -1 return.
